name: Turtle Bay Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those not in the know, Turtle Bay resort is the hotel from the movie "Forgetting Sarah Marshall", although it is quite hard to see the similarities between the film and the resort.
reviews.title: Out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort is a fair way out of the main drag of Honolulu so if your using Turtle Bay as a base for your whole stay in Hawaii...don't. That said, Turtle Bay is a great base to explore the North Coast of Oahu. Its a fairly quiet and withdrawn place but there is plenty to do for families and couples around the resort and the area but its not great if you are wanting to do some tourist activities around Waikiki or the Southern parts of the island.
reviews.title: Wish I could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and parts of the resort are a bit dated but spacious. The views from the room are quite good and the restaurants at the resort serve great food. The room rates are quite pricey for what you get so its not great value for money but its great if your after a quiet Hawaiian escape.
reviews.title: Points to ponder

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real Hawaii is at Turtle Bay. It is the perfect location to getaway from it all.
reviews.title: Nice place for a good getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watched whales jumping from our room in the morning, snorkelled in the bay all afternoon.
reviews.title: Hawaiian slice of heaven on the north shore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We visited the resort the first two weeks of February 2013 - but I'm just getting a moment to write our review now. We knew we'd be there during construction, but didn't do too much research to figure out what parts of the hotel were being worked on while we'd be there. I was bummed that the buffet-style restaurant was out of commission (as another reviewer noted, buffets are really helpful when you're traveling with little kids) and I was also sad that the main gift shop (which I remembered fondly from our last trip) was closed during our visit. That said, we found our way and had an excellent time.
reviews.title: Second visit (during renovations) just as good as our first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of us would go down to get coffee and breakfast sandwiches from the lobby bar, and we'd often get sandwiches there to enjoy for lunch later. Then we'd spend mornings at the beach and afternoons at the pool. All of the hotel restaurants are yummy - and room service was prompt and convenient, too.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, but in serious need of upgrades

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had amazing views from our room and could see whales (mating?) from our window.
reviews.title: The peaceful side of Oahu!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had two spa treatments during our stay - and though the new spa was not open yet - I actually enjoyed having my treatments in a private room. It made it even more relaxing.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband played two rounds of golf, and enjoyed the courses, as usual.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was fantastic! I don't know why some VERY picky people think that the rooms are outdated. It was fairly freshly painted, the rug was nice - if you want posh, this is not the room for you, but it was very nice! My room was a very standard room on the 2nd floor with an ocean view. I guess the resort calls it a partial ocean view, but the only obstructions were some leaves from 2 very spaced out palms trees. I could even see humpback whales jumping in and out of the water numerous times every day from my balcony - not called a balcony because it is only about 2 ft wide, but you can step out of the patio doors onto it and, if you wish, put your chairs from your room at the doors and enjoy it just like a balcony. I don't see the reason for some of the bad reviews. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Mahalo especially to Pete at the Bell desk and Jubeth my housekeeping lady! They both went the extra mile to welcome me and make me feel at home.
reviews.title: Awesome place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The snorkelling at this resort was better than all of the other spots we snorkelled. Each time we snorkelled we saw many things you don't normally see - unicorn fish, goat fish, peacock flounder, sea turtle (every time!), lots of sea cucumbers, to name a few.
reviews.title: Fantastic Wedding Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great time here, but was not able to eat there as it is way overpriced. For breakfast, if you want one order of bacon and eggs, it is $26.00. We had breakfast down the road at the Shark's Cove Grill for $5.00 each, bought baked goods at Ted's Bakery for breakfast, lunch or a snack, ate at the shrimp trucks, which were all great - escpecially Giovanni's and ate at Tita's Place (awesome - former Montreal Allouette Pro Football player - go Canada!)
reviews.title: Forget Honolulu and Waikiki, Go Here Instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone not into the crowds of a big city, someone who wants to rent a car and tour the island (lots to see) and chill on the beach.
reviews.title: Such a Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thank you everyone at Turtle Bay Resort for making our Valentine's Day wedding this year so special. We had an amazing day and will cherish the memories forever. Travelling from Australia and never having been to Hawaii before we had no idea what to expect. Mikilani, the Catering Event Manager, was fantastic and made our day truly memorable. All the arrangements were perfect and her friendly personality made a lasting impression. Liz from North Shore Weddings and Flowers organised our beautiful flowers, leis, bouquet and floral arrangement. The flowers were amazing. The Salon girls from Spa Luana also did an exceptional job styling our hair and are to be commended for their patience. We held our wedding dinner at 21 Degrees North and the meal and wedding cake were delicious. I highly recommend Turtle Bay to any one considering a destination wedding in Hawaii. We are looking forward to returning in the future and seeing all the changes when the renovations have been completed.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: This was the first stop on our honeymoon . Only an hour drive from the airport . When we arrived we were super early but they let us in our room by 12 when check in is usually a lot later. The view from our room was amazing . All the restaurants around the resort were great . If you have a hire car there are lots of great things to do during the day along the north shore . Will definitely go back .
reviews.title: Amazing resort , beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at night and I was worried. This resort is rough looking compared to other resorts in Hawaii, including the one we had arrived from. You are not checking it to a Marriott so you cannot expect that type of luxury or above. This is not a travel agency brochure type place. If this is your first trip to hawaii, then I would definitely stay at another major resort, as well. Do not watch Forgetting Sarah Marshall and expect to walk on the set- Totally 100% different. Would not even remind me of the movie.
reviews.title: Great for people wanting to add to their Hawaiian experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Here is what you can expect in the negative column- really old rooms- like no major chain would have in operation (by major chain, I mean hampton Inn, Residence Inn), some poorly manicured landscape- mud and dead/dying plants, puddles all over pool area (kids sliding around, etc). There was also the renovation. It was not contained to one area, but everywhere you will definitely walk around sawdust, mud, etc. No breakfast buffet (buffets are good with our little kids).
reviews.title: Secluded hotel for honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives- Very KIND staff...no one really seemed like they went to hospitality school just really nice people (with one strange exception with the reception girl- but maybe this is an example of how kind they are to hire someone that really wasn't that nice). Very laid back- all different kinds of people here- lots of families, couples, and singles seem to mesh really well here. Beautiful natural location ( but so was our previous hotel so we were spoiled), great hiking (you can go on foot, horse, atv, segway), lots of different restaurant types at the hotel (young surfer bar, upscale 21 degrees, resorty Ola, beach bar Hang Ten). Finally, you get a feeling that you are getting a more local, authentic experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort that seduces you into total relaxation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK- the pool was fine. Pretty warm, pretty crowded, nice view of the ocean and surfers. However, was a little muddy around the edges of the pool deck and some plants that looks pretty weathered.
reviews.title: The only hotel on the North Shore

description: Set on 880 ocean-front acres of Oahu, Turtle Bay Resort is the only true full-service luxury resort on the island's legendary North Shore. Modern architecture graces this six story hotel on Kuilima Point, where all rooms provide an oceanview. Our guests enjoy the natural tranquility of the North Shore lifestyle and spectacular ocean views from every one of the 443 magnificent beach cottages and guest rooms. The resort features two lushly landscaped pools, two championship golf courses, ten tennis courts, horseback riding, hiking and mountain bike trails, a surfing school, world-class dining and shopping. For group meetings, the Conference Center at Turtle Bay Resort houses the latest in learning and presentation technology with more than 31,000 square feet of meeting space. Video conference hosting, high speed wireless Internet and a host of other IACC approved technologies are available.
